item.title: 力拓铜业老板称建矿山胜过买矿山
item.description: 力拓集团（Rio Tinto Group）铜矿主管表示，他认为建设矿山比购买现有资产更有价值；这一评论可能会让期待矿业交易再次热潮的行业观察家们失望。【原文：Rio Tinto Group’s copper head says he sees much more value in building mines rather than buying existing assets — comments that may disappoint industry observers anticipating another spate of mining dealmaking.】

item.title: 巴菲特公用事业公司称需要更多天然气厂来满足需求
item.description: 沃伦-巴菲特（Warren Buffett）的伯克希尔-哈撒韦公司（Berkshire Hathaway Inc.【原文：Executives of US Western utilities owned by Warren Buffett’s Berkshire Hathaway Inc. conglomerate said more natural gas power plants will be needed to supply unprecedented demand growth on their systems.】

item.title: 美国证券交易委员会针对自己员工的短信行为，禁止在工作手机上使用 WhatsApp
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会已禁止第三方信息应用程序和短信进入员工的工作手机，从而使自己的做法更接近于为行业执行的标准。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission has blocked third-party messaging apps and texts from employees’ work mobile phones, bringing its own practices closer to the standards it’s enforcing for the industry.】

item.title: 加拿大提高资本利得税，为住房筹集数十亿资金
item.description: 加拿大将提高对企业和富裕个人的资本利得税，以帮助支付数百亿元的新支出，这些支出旨在使住房更加经济实惠并帮助年轻人。【原文：Canada will raise capital gains taxes on businesses and wealthy individuals to help pay for tens of billions in new spending aimed at making housing more affordable and helping young people.】

item.title: 财政部现金余额因纳税额增加而创下两年来最大增幅
item.description: 周一，美国财政部的现金余额激增，因为政府在四月中旬所得税截止日期前支付的税款纷至沓来。【原文：The US Treasury’s cash balance surged on Monday as payments poured in at the government’s mid-April deadline for income taxes.】

item.title: 随着 F1 零净排放期限的临近，电动方程式展示了赛车运动的未来之路
item.description: 一级方程式赛车是一个体育帝国，拥有摇滚明星车手、价值数十亿美元的车队以及相当于一个非洲小国的碳足迹。电动方程式赛车（Formula E）是与之相对应的纯电动赛车，其规模仅为一级方程式赛车的一小部分，但却是赛车运动的未来。【原文：Formula One is a sporting empire complete with rock star drivers, billion-dollar teams and a carbon footprint equal to a small African country. Formula E, its all-electric counterpart, is just a fraction of that in size but is the future of racing.】

item.title: 红龙虾考虑破产以解决租赁和劳动力成本问题
item.description: 据知情人士透露，海鲜连锁餐厅 Red Lobster 正在酝酿申请破产保护，以寻求债务重组。【原文：Seafood restaurant chain Red Lobster is mulling a Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing as it looks to restructure its debt, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 日元短暂飙升显示交易员对干预高度敏感
item.description: 据野村证券公司（Nomura Plc）称，日元周二突然升值可能是由于交易商对日本决策者干预货币的风险日益敏感，而非外汇市场上任何官方行动的结果。【原文：The yen’s sudden surge in value Tuesday was the likely result of traders increasingly sensitive to the risk of currency intervention by Japanese policymakers and not the result of any official action in foreign-exchange markets, according to Nomura Plc.】

item.title: 得克萨斯州小额贷款借款人对限制银行的反 ESG 法律表示遗憾
item.description: 德克萨斯州的借款人聚集在一个行业会议上，对该州由共和党支持的两项法律表示遗憾，发行人称这两项法律限制了他们可以与哪些华尔街银行开展业务。【原文：Texas borrowers gathered at an industry conference bemoaned two Republican-backed laws in the state that issuers say have restricted which Wall Street banks they can do business with.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）董事会修改贷款规则以加速债务重组
item.description: 国际货币基金组织执行董事会投票决定改革其支持债务重组的程序，允许在债权人坚持反对的情况下继续推进债务重组计划。【原文：The International Monetary Fund’s executive board voted to reform its process of supporting debt restructurings by allowing programs to move ahead despite holdout creditors.】

item.title: 鲍威尔发出信号：通胀持续将推迟降息
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔表示，最近的通胀数据表明，央行可能需要更长时间才能获得降息所需的信心。【原文：Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said recent inflation data have indicated it will likely take longer for the central bank to attain the confidence needed to lower interest rates.】

item.title: 美国两年期收益率突破 5%，达到 11 月以来最高水平
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）表示，近期数据显示通胀率在向央行2%的目标迈进方面缺乏进一步进展，此后美国两年期收益率突破5%，升至11月以来的最高水平。【原文：The US two-year yield rose past 5% to the highest level since November after Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell said recent data show a lack of further progress of inflation toward the central bank’s 2% goal.】

item.title: 凯茜-伍德的 ARKK 创五个月新低，特斯拉助长了亏损势头
item.description: 凯茜-伍德（Cathie Wood）的旗舰基金股价跌至五个月低点，原因是其最大持股公司特斯拉公司（Tesla Inc.【原文：Shares in Cathie Wood’s flagship fund slid to a five-month low as Tesla Inc., its biggest holding, dropped after a round of job cuts stoked investors’ worries about the carmaker’s growth prospects.】

item.title: 中国称新市场规则不会导致大规模退市
item.description: 在小盘股暴跌之后，中国最高证券监管机构试图消除投资者对证券交易所新规的担忧，称他们预计退市潮不会因新规变化而激增。【原文：China’s top securities regulator tried to allay investor concerns about new stock exchange rules following a rout in small-cap shares, saying they don’t expect a surge in delistings as a result of the changes.】

item.title: 纳米比亚将于 2024 年底就石油发现做出最终投资决定
item.description: 纳米比亚将把从潜在的大规模石油发现中获得的大部分收入投入主权财富基金，并希望在今年晚些时候了解这一发现是否具有商业可行性。【原文：Namibia will invest a big chunk of any revenue it gets from a potentially massive oil discovery into a sovereign wealth fund, and expects to learn if the find is commercially viable later this year.】

item.title: Riverside 探索出售其私人信贷部门的可能性
item.description: 据知情人士透露，Riverside Co. 正在探索战略选择，包括出售其直接贷款部门 Riverside Credit Solutions。【原文：Riverside Co. is exploring strategic options including a sale of its direct lending arm, Riverside Credit Solutions, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 夏威夷电力公司在毛伊岛火灾报告前创下 40 年新低
item.description: 当地新闻报道称，对毛伊岛毁灭性大火的调查并未发现急救人员的过失，夏威夷电力公司的股价因此创下 40 年来的新低。【原文：Hawaiian Electric stock hit a 40-year low in the wake of a local news report that a probe of the devastating Maui fires does not find fault with first responders.】

item.title: 如果市场下滑，花旗退出债券市场将面临流动性考验
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup Inc. 是市政债务承销商中常年排名前十的公司）最近离开了市政债务承销商行业，这可能最终会在下一次市政债务衰退中带来挑战，两个最大的市场参与者的官员说。【原文：The recent departure of Citigroup Inc., a perennial top-10 underwriter of municipal debt, from that industry may eventually pose a challenge in the next muni downturn, said officials at two of the largest market participants.】

item.title: 战争风险加剧，石油交易商赌 6 月油价将达 250 美元
item.description: 由于地缘政治风险依然高企，石油交易商们大举买入价值超过 300 万桶的期权合约，赌石油价格到 6 月份将飙升至每桶 250 美元。【原文：Oil traders piled into more than 3 million barrels worth of options contracts in a bet that prices would spike to $250 a barrel by June as geopolitical risks remain elevated.】

item.title: 维勒鲁瓦称，欧洲央行将在今年和明年 6 月后加大降息力度
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会成员弗朗索瓦-维勒鲁瓦-德-加尔豪（Francois Villeroy de Galhau）表示，继 6 月份首次降息后，欧洲中央银行今明两年将需要进一步降息。【原文：The European Central Bank will need to make further reductions to interest rates this year and next, following an initial move in June, according to Governing Council member Francois Villeroy de Galhau.】

item.title: 摩根大通称外国投资者青睐美国高等级债务
item.description: 摩根大通公司（JPMorgan Chase & Co.【原文：US investment-grade bonds are looking attractive to foreign buyers as yields rise and hedging costs drop, according to JPMorgan Chase & Co.】

item.title: 欧盟报告呼吁整合电信业，打造强大的能源市场
item.description: 欧盟委托撰写的一份竞争力报告称，欧盟应考虑将电信运营商的整合作为改善集团移动和固定网络的一种方式，并应进一步整合其能源市场。【原文：The European Union should consider consolidation for telecom operators as a way to improve the bloc’s mobile and fixed networks and should further integrate its energy markets, according to a report it commissioned on competitiveness.】

item.title: 交易商已开始博弈对俄罗斯金属的新制裁措施
item.description: 在英国和美国禁止俄罗斯铝、铜和镍未来在伦敦金属交易所销售后不到一天，交易商们就找到了利用错综复杂的新规则赚钱的方法。【原文：It took less than a day after the UK and US banned future sales of Russian aluminum, copper and nickel on the London Metal Exchange before traders had zeroed in on a way to make money off the convoluted new rules.】

item.title: 在 1924 年开启共同基金时代后，MFS 计划进军 ETF 领域
item.description: 继 100 年前推出世界上第一只共同基金之后，MFS 投资管理公司准备在 ETF 市场上首次亮相。【原文：After launching the world’s first mutual fund 100 years ago, MFS Investment Management is poised to make its debut in the ETF market.】

item.title: Taconic Capital 和合并套利老将 Charles Slotnik 在交易回暖之际推出基金
item.description: 随着交易市场出现生机勃勃的迹象，在经历了去年的长期沉寂之后，又出现了几只独立的兼并套利基金，押注于预期的交易活动。【原文：With the deal market showing signs of life, a couple of standalone merger arbitrage funds have emerged to bet on the anticipated activity after a long dormancy last year.】

item.title: Trafigura 首席执行官称铜价必须突破 10,000 美元才能满足需求
item.description: Trafigura 集团首席执行官杰里米-威尔（Jeremy Weir）说，为了填补到 2034 年可能出现的 800 万吨供应缺口，矿业公司需要价格高于每吨 10,000 美元，甚至可能高达 12,000 美元。【原文：In order to fill a potential supply gap of 8 million tons by 2034, mining companies need prices that are higher than $10,000 a ton and possibly as high as $12,000, says Trafigura Group Chief Executive Officer Jeremy Weir.】

item.title: Orsted 称，美国海上风电成本将逐渐降低
item.description: Orsted A/S 美洲业务负责人在参加彭博电视台的一次节目时表示，美国海上风电项目建设价格的飙升是受借贷成本膨胀的推动。【原文：Surging price tags to build US offshore wind projects have been driven by swollen borrowing costs, the head of Orsted A/S’s Americas business said during an appearance on Bloomberg Television.】

item.title: 世界贸易组织（WTO）总裁警告特朗普提高关税计划将带来 "人人自由 "的局面
item.description: 世界贸易组织负责人表示，美国前总统唐纳德-特朗普提高美国进口商品关税的计划将引发全球贸易体系的 "自由竞争"，使现有规则失去作用，并损害每个经济体的利益。【原文：Former President Donald Trump’s plan to raise tariffs on US imports would spark a “free for all” in the global trading system that renders existing rules useless and hurts every economy, the head of the World Trade Organization said.】

item.title: Permira 考虑出售德国化学品公司 CABB
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，收购公司 Permira 正在考虑以超过 10 亿欧元（10.6 亿美元）的价格出售特种化学品制造商 CABB，因为该公司在瑞士上市的计划在 2022 年没有取得成果。【原文：Buyout firm Permira is considering a sale of specialty chemicals manufacturer CABB for more than €1 billion ($1.06 billion) after plans to list the company in Switzerland didn’t bear fruit in 2022, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 安德森-霍洛维茨（Andreessen Horowitz）融资 72 亿美元，计划在 2025 年实现更多融资
item.description: 安德森-霍洛维茨公司（Andreessen Horowitz）是硅谷最大的风险投资公司之一，该公司已筹集到 72 亿美元的新资金。【原文：Andreessen Horowitz, one of Silicon Valley’s biggest venture capital firms, has raised $7.2 billion in new funding — a sizable haul after a rocky period for the startup world.】
